title: Puberty
description: Learn about the physical changes that occur during puberty.
lesson: Puberty is the process an individual goes through when their body begins to develop and change as they move from childhood to adulthood. Physical changes include growth spurts, development of reproductive organs, and body hair.

activities.question: What is puberty?
options: Body changes during transition to adulthood
activities.answer: Body changes during transition to adulthood

title: Reproductive System
description: Understand the male and female reproductive organs.
lesson: The reproductive system includes organs needed to produce offspring. Males have a penis, scrotum, testes, and vas deferens. Females have ovaries, fallopian tubes, uterus, cervix, and vagina.

activities.question: Which of the following is part of the female reproductive system?

title: Menstrual Cycle
description: Learn about the monthly cycle and what happens during menstruation.
lesson: The menstrual cycle is a monthly process where the uterus prepares for a possible pregnancy. If no pregnancy occurs, the lining of the uterus sheds—this is menstruation.

activities.question: What happens if there is no pregnancy during the menstrual cycle?

title: Premenstrual Syndrome (PMS)
description: Explore common symptoms experienced before or during menstruation.
lesson: Premenstrual Syndrome (PMS) includes symptoms such as mood changes, breast pain, headache, back pain, acne, and food cravings, occurring before or during menstruation.

activities.question: Which of these is a PMS symptom?

title: Tracking Your Menstrual Cycle
description: Learn how and why to track your menstrual cycle.
lesson: A regular menstrual cycle lasts between 21–35 days. Tracking helps you understand your body and prepare for your period. You can monitor mood, period heaviness, and pain level.

activities.question: How long is a regular menstrual cycle?

title: Menstrual Hygiene
description: How to keep clean during menstruation and avoid infections.
lesson: Wash the genital area with clean water and mild soap. Change pads or tampons regularly. Avoid strong chemicals or douches. Always wash hands before and after changing materials.

activities.question: What should you avoid when cleaning during menstruation?

title: Proper Disposal
description: How to properly dispose of menstrual hygiene materials.
lesson: Wrap used pads or tampons in paper before throwing them in the trash. Do not flush pads or tampons down the toilet.

activities.question: What should you NOT do with used pads?

title: Myths and Facts
description: Debunk common myths and replace them with facts.
lesson: Myths such as 'You shouldn’t shower on your period' or 'Periods are dirty' are false. Showering is safe, and menstruation is healthy and natural.

activities.question: Is it safe to shower while on your period?

title: Gender and Support
description: Learn about gender roles and how to support menstruating girls.
lesson: Gender refers to roles shaped by society, while sex refers to biological differences. Support menstruating girls by not teasing, being respectful, and offering help.

activities.question: What is a good way to support menstruating girls?

title: Nutrition and Health Tips
description: Discover proper nutrition and health habits during menstruation.
lesson: Eat a balanced diet with fruits and vegetables. Avoid too much junk food or sugary snacks. Stay hydrated, get enough sleep, and eat three meals daily.

activities.question: Which food should you avoid too much during your period?
